page.title: 06THE STONE AT SCAR
page.content: At Scar there stands a huge glaciated mass of rock.It originally stood 2 miles away at Saville,but was moved under the orders of the Laird of Scar. It was pulled by horses,many of which were strained in the process.There is no rock like it,geologically,on Sanday and it is thought to have broken away from a glacier in the ice_age,possibly from Iceland or Norway. The rock is 1.17 metres high,1.02 metres wide and 1.10 metres long. Over the years,the sheer weight of the rock has made it sink into the ground, so that only approximately 7/8 of it is visible and measurable. It stands in the corner of a small field which is in front of the house,once in full view of the laird. The island no longer has any lairds.
